intro: Villamilla tinctoria, commonly known as the redwood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. It is known for its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it an interesting species for horticultural and botanical study.
